paragraphs.text: Does Europe remember the Geneva Convention?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: "A few months ago someone starved to death in our squat," said Muna a 26-year- old Somali woman who has been living inside a run-down university building in Rome since 2006

paragraphs.text: Selam Palace, where over 1,000 refugees live, has become the symbol of Italy's "migration crisis"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: They are the lucky ones; the ones who made it

paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: those working on the ground argue that repressive border practices and ineffective policies are to blame

paragraphs.text: In Sicily, asylum seekers have been housed inside churches, gyms and abandoned schools, often in overcrowded and unsanitary conditions
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Fights have become frequent inside these centres
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: where migrants are abandoned for months, even years, with very little idea of what is happening to them

paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: as we drove past the CARA Mineo, a processing centre for migrants
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which currently holds over 4,000 people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Stuck between EU regulations, which force them to claim asylum in their first port of call, and the inefficiencies of Italian bureaucracy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: many migrants in Italy end up in a limbo of illegality and destitution
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On my first day in Sicily I met Adeel, a 26-year-old Pakistani man
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who lives in a shanty town just outside a processing centre, with 200 other asylum seekers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "The centre is full
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: some people began to set up camp underneath a bridge in its proximity," he said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Come back in two weeks' time," said Adeel over the phone
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "Every so often they do that because they say the camp is illegal
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But we just build it again
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: where else can we go?"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: However the problem is not just the number of arrivals, but the mismanagement of the asylum system
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Year on year the government declares a state of emergency to deal with immigration," said Manuela Scebba
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: who works for the NGO Arci Amari
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "The problem is that there isn't a plan
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The wars are not going to stop
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: What are we going to do next year? Call another emergency?" she adds
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "The EU is progressively closing its borders, moving them further south along the Mediterranean," says Carmen Cordaro a lawyer
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: who specialises in maritime border policy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "In this context, the debate over search and rescue missions is almost futile
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: What we really need is an EU policy on migration that goes beyond surveillance and push-backs
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: which at the moment is virtually non- existent."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In a bid to contain the flow of migrants, EU border-states have traditionally made agreements with neighbouring countries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which do not share their onerous duties towards upholding the human rights of asylum seekers, enshrined in the Geneva Convention
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Despite being in contravention of national and international laws, several EU countries have used push-backs as a means of border control
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Spanish Guardia Civil (national law enforcement agency) has often been criticised for handing over migrants to Morocco
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there are numerous reports of mass expulsions from Greece to Turkey
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "In Europe there seems to be a concerted effort to evade the Geneva Convention
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Why doesn't the EU just come out and say it: We no longer want to abide by the Geneva Convention," Cordaro said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There are virtually no legal entry routes into Europe; even for asylum seekers fleeing from war-torn countries like Syria
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Far from countering migration flows this approach to migration has merely fuelled the human smuggling market and splintered migration routes towards longer and more dangerous points of passage
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Earlier this year I travelled across Italy to document the stories of those who arrive to Italy's borders
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Europe or Die", the name of the documentary, refers to a phrase which a group of men screamed at the producer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: as
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they plunged towards the 3m barbwire fence which separates Spain from Morocco
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: For the past 10 years Italy has declared a "state of emergency" in relation to migration nearly every year
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In the meantime, the human rights of migrants have been increasingly sidelined in favour of quick-fix solutions to the "crisis" and tighter border controls
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Far from an emergency, the influxes, the deaths and the overcrowding of centres are the predictable consequences of denying a legal entry route to those who have no other choice but to flee
paragraphs.label: assumption
